title: #310 The State of BI in 2025 | Howard Dresner, Godfather of BI

rawLines.text: When I talk about business intelligence,
a term that I coined back in 1989, it
was always intended to be an umbrella
term. So, it not tied to a specific
technology. It's really about factbased
analysis, which is driven by data. We've
seen that evolve a lot over the past few
years. And now, of course, you know, you
look at things like agentic analytics
and conversational analytics. Well,
that's all part of business intelligence
because the intent is to deliver the
same capabilities. How do we deliver
datadriven fact-based analysis? We have
so many external forces operating our
organizations. Data is your friend. You
want to know when things are changing
and how they're changing as quickly as
possible so that you can react. I mean,
at the end of the day, that's the whole
point of business intelligence. How do

quickly as possible?
Welcome to dataf framed. This is Richie.

semantic layers are making a difference.

And now, of course, you know, you look at things like agentic analytics and conversational analytics. Well, that's all part of business intelligence because the intent is to deliver the same capabilities. How do we deliver datadriven fact-based analysis? We have so many external forces operating our organizations. Data is your friend. You want to know when things are changing and how they're changing as quickly as possible so that you can react.
